text: Slightly French is a 1949 American musical comedy film directed by Douglas Sirk and starring Dorothy Lamour, Don Ameche and Janis Carter.Stern p.59 The screenplay concerns a Hollywood director who recruits an American singer. ==Premise== After clashing with the French star of his film who then quits, a Hollywood director recruits an American singer who he tries to pass off as a Frenchwoman. ==Partial cast== * Dorothy Lamour as Mary O'Leary aka Rochelle Olivia * Don Ameche as John Gayle * Janis Carter as Louisa Gayle * Willard Parker as Douglas Hyde * Adele Jergens as Yvonne La Tour * Jeanne Manet as Nicolette ==References== ==Bibliography== * Stern, Michael. Douglas Sirk.
